text: Douglas Russell Feaver (1914–1997) was the Bishop of Peterborough in the Church of England from 1972New bishop is nominated for Peterborough. By Our Religious Affairs Correspondent The Times (London, England), Thursday, Aug 24, 1972; pg. 14; Issue 58561 to 1984. Fever was educated at Bristol Grammar School and Keble College, Oxford;"A Field Guide to the English Clergy' Butler- Gallie, F p119: London, Oneworld Publications, 2018 and ordained in 1938.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1975-76 London p317: Oxford University Press, 1976 He was a curate at St Alban's Abbey then a wartime chaplain in the RAFVR. He later became Sub-Dean of the abbey, Rural Dean of Nottingham (and Vicar of St Mary's) before becoming Peterborough's Bishop.‘FEAVER, Rt Rev. Douglas Russell’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2015; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 25 Jan 2015 ==References== ==External links== * St Mary's, Nottingham Category:1914 births Category:1997 deaths Category:People educated at Bristol Grammar School Category:Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve personnel of World War II Category:Royal Air Force chaplains Category:Vicars of St Mary's Church, Nottingham Category:Bishops of Peterborough Category:Alumni of Keble College, Oxford
title: Douglas Feaver
